title: Standard Changes, Automated Execution
hook: Speed in SAP AMS doesn’t come from shortcuts. It comes from removing choice where choice is unnecessary.
idea: A large share of SAP changes are predictable, low-risk, and repetitive. Treat them as products: standardized, automated, and boring.

sap_reality.problem: Handled as ‘special cases’, they waste senior attention and create inconsistency.

standard_change_model.definition: A change with known impact, known test steps, known rollback, and zero creativity required.
assets: One-click rollback or clear reversal steps

execution_flow: Request via chat using a strict template

copilot_moves: Validate input against SAP constraints before execution
Generate transports or execution scripts where possible
human_role: Improve the standard when it breaks

rules: If a standard change causes an incident, it is paused and fixed.
If the same manual change is done three times, it becomes a standard.
No emergency path for things that can be standardized.
why_this_is_better_and_cheaper: Senior experts focus on real problems
metrics_that_force_discipline: Percent of changes executed via standard path
Average cycle time vs non-standard changes
design_question: Why are smart people still doing dumb repetitive work?
